class bad_weak_ptr;
}}

{{tt|std::bad_weak_ptr}} is the type of the object thrown as exceptions by the constructors of {{lc|std::shared_ptr}} that take {{lc|std::weak_ptr}} as the argument, when the {{lc|std::weak_ptr}} refers to an already deleted object.

{{inheritance diagram/std-bad_weak_ptr}}

===Member functions===
{{cpp/error/exception/member of derived|bad_weak_ptr|std=c++11}}

{{cpp/error/exception/inherit}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;memory&gt;

int main()
{
    std::shared_ptr&lt;int&gt; p1(new int(42));
    std::weak_ptr&lt;int&gt; wp(p1);
    p1.reset();
    try
    {
        std::shared_ptr&lt;int&gt; p2(wp);
    }
    catch (const std::bad_weak_ptr&amp; e)
    {
        std::cout &lt;&lt; e.what() &lt;&lt; '\n';
    }
}
|p=true
|output=
std::bad_weak_ptr
}}
